intro: Echites campestris, commonly known as the field echites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Echites campestris is often used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory properties.
